title: [Bypass fixed #664038 and #519059] Application settings change settings that have been set by the user

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
I have reported this bug in report #681361 so that you make a FULL fix, but you refused (considered duplicate) and I have to wait for report #664038 to be resolved, now I come again to report the bug.

The settings for "protected tweets" that have been set from another application accidentally change after the user changes the settings on the twitter application.

## Step To Reproduction
1. Set "protected tweets" from the Twitter Web or Twitter Lite application
2. Confirm and make sure that "tweet is protected" from the web or lite
3. then open the twitter application and change the hashtag (#) setting from OFF to ON

This method will trigger problems in the settings between the web and Twitter applications so that what has been set from outside the Twitter application can change.


##the bug in this report has the same impact as report #664038 and #519059 but this bugs can still be triggered even though one of these bugs in reports has been fixed.


I say that because the bug in report #664038 and #519059 has been fixed and I can trigger the bug again in new versi app twitter 8.16.0 release 00


## my conclusion this bug is ==Bypassing significant controls== because after this bug is fixed it can be triggered again

## Impact

accidentally the "protected tweet" setting OFF and user tweets seen publicly

activities.message:
Thank you for your report @jaka_tingkir,

We were able to reproduce the behavior you described. However, during our testing we encountered a strange behavior which we would like to discuss with you. After a few minutes of testing, we encountered an issue on `twitter.com` which prevented us from changing our "protect my Tweets" setting. ███████  Did you encounter this behavior in any of your tests?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
I encountered that problem when I tried to set a "protected tweet" by testing using the Twitter Lite application, i never encountered if i used  the Twitter application.

I want to ask you, "You can produce but why not triage right away? Because the impact is clear and the method is appropriate".


please do not discuss those that are not included in the TOPIC
thank you

Thank you for your response @jaka_tingkir,

> "You can produce but why not triage right away? Because the impact is clear and the method is appropriate".

Just to clarify, we may ask additional questions before triaging to make sure we fully understand the behavior that has been reported to our program. This information can help us better understand what impact a behavior has, what components a behavior impacts, and the likelihood of the attack scenario described by the researcher. Sometimes this information is not needed for triage, but regardless it can still help us better manage the researcher's report in a timely manner. 

That being said, we are evaluating the behavior you described and will get back to you when we have more information.


Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
Well, I'll answer be happy if have questions from you.

Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
I will look forward to hearing from you

I hope you make a full improvement.

thank you

hallo @yongjink
I want to add a POC that shows other effects that are also happening,

not only the "protect tweets" setting even when users make any changes through other application settings can also be changed or not set after making changes to the Twitter application settings.

like renaming, watch the video ███
there is the latest news?

it looks like the root of the problem in `twitter.com`.
In my opinion, because Twitter.com stores web history that has different settings is saved, resulting in differences in data or settings between the web and applications.

see my new video ███

in the video I tried setting the "protected tweet" setting of the application then opened the web and made changes to the settings on twitter.com so that there was an error setting like your video ████████
so the settings for "protected tweets" are irregular or not according to what the user has applied
@yongjink can you reply?

@jaka_tingkir, I sincerely apologize for the delay. We are still having internal discussion. We will get back to you as soon as we have more details. Thanks again for your patience and thinking of Twitter security!

btw is there an additional bonus?
because this report can be improved through two reports at once?

coincidentally my device is broken so I have to buy a new one and I'm waiting for your bounty.

greetings and thank you
@yongjink previously only need 10 days from of triage status to get a bounty.
@jaka_tingkir, Sorry for the delay. We will be able to get back to you by next Wednesday. Thanks again for your patience.

according to the program policies.

@jaka_tingkir, As mentioned above, we will be able to get back to you by next Wednesday. Sorry and thanks again for your patience.
